alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 4:18AM EDT until June 21 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Dixie, Lafayette and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Steinhatchee, Cross City, Tennille, Clara, Salem, Howell Place, Carbur, Jena, Jonesboro, Fish Creek, Hines, Blue Springs, Bird Island, Cedar Island, Cooks Hammock, Keaton Beach, Jack Lee Island, Athena, Jug Island and Dekle Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
